conbody.p: Kerberos works with hostnames. The NCCNS Kafka client needs to resolve the hostname of the kerberos server/kdc.
The IP to hostname mapping(s) of the Kerberos server must be added to the /etc/hosts of the SPSNS container. This can be done by the following:

li.p: Add the following keys to SDC from the OAME (or any other) node. One key each for each hostname that needs to be resolved to an IP.
Note: It is recommended to contact Nokia support to add keys to the SDC.
The entry of the added hosts will be added to /etc/hosts of the NCCNS container on TPA restart (using TPA_control stop and TPA_control start) of the comsvc node(s)

Note: The addition of external hosts to the hosts file of SPSNS containers is done only for the NCC BVNF solution. For NCC BCMT solution, the entry for external hosts must be added manually to all the NS containers.
